com.magnet.core.api

Interface ServicesWriteable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.magnet.core.api.ServiceInfoProvider, Services, ServicesLookup
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ServicesLockable

    @Contract
public interface ServicesWriteable
extends Services
    An extension of Services that supports dynamic runtime registration for service components.

    • Method Summary

      • registerDynamic

        Reference<?> registerDynamic(Object service)
        Register a service, returning its registration reference.

      • getRegisteredService

        Releaseable getRegisteredService(Reference<?> ref)
        Obtains a handle to a releasable service reference. Calling release will cause the backing service to go away (i.e., calling PostConstruct, Close, etc.) and eventually become garbage collected.

        This is currently only supported on dynamic services.

      • create

        <T> T create(Class<T> serviceClass)
        Creates a services by class name, and then injects all of the injection points. This method also supports constructor injection (according to JSR-330 if applicable).

      • initialize

        <T> T initialize(T service)
        Takes an instance new'ed manually, and injects all of the injection points, followed by calling PostConstruct and PostStarted conditionally based on state of the kernel.

        This does NOT register a service into the services registration however. This should not be called on a service that is being managed by the platform.

      • createAndInitialize

        <T> T createAndInitialize(Class<T> serviceClass)
        Creates the service by class, satisfies the injection points, and then handles the PostConstruct and PostStarted conditionally based on state of the kernel.

        This does NOT register a service into the services registration however. This should not be called on a service that is being managed by the platform.

      • destroy

        <T> void destroy(T service)
        Handles termination lifecycle by conditionally calling PreDestroy and Closeable.

        This does NOT unregister a service from the services registration however. This should not be called on a service that is being managed by the platform.

      • isReady

        boolean isReady()
        Returns true if this services registry instance is in a ready state.

      • dump

        void dump(PrintWriter out)
        Dump the services registry state to the provided print writer (if possible).
